source.name: Oracle Definition in Blockchain
source.instructions: Which of the following best defines the concept of oracles in the context of blockchain and smart contracts?

answers.answer: Services that provide external data to blockchain-based smart contracts
Cryptographic algorithms used to secure blockchain networks
Decentralized applications running on top of blockchain platforms
Oracles expand the potential applications of smart contracts

source.guidance: Oracles are correctly defined as services that provide external data to blockchain-based smart contracts. This definition captures their primary function in bridging the gap between on-chain and off-chain environments. The other options, while related to blockchain technology, do not accurately describe oracles. Blockchain transaction verification is typically done by nodes or miners, not oracles. Cryptographic algorithms are used in blockchain security but are not specific to oracles. Decentralized applications (dApps) are distinct from oracles, though they may utilize oracle services.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT define and explain the concept of oracles in blockchain ecosystems
